Class DrawPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • DrawPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DrawPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    this class extends JPanel and lets the user create random shapes and counts the amount of shapes of each type. JPanel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DrawPanel(javax.swing.JLabel coordinatesLabel, DrawFrame parentWindow)
      this method sets the background color to white and creates an array in a size of MAXSHAPES(100) of type MyShape it also sets the coordinates (x,y) displayed on the screen and shows the mouse place creates a mouse handler and sets a mouse listener and a motion listener.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Clear()
      when the button Clear is clicked the drawing panel will be cleared of ALL the shapes!
      private MyShape createShape(int shapeType, java.awt.Color color, boolean filled, int... coordinates)
      this method creates the shapes. recieves the shape type, color and wether the shape is filled.
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      this method prints the shapes.
      void SetColor(java.awt.Color color)
      this method sets the color of the shape
      void SetFilled(boolean filled)
      this method sets the oval/rectangle to filled or not filled.
      void SetShapesType(int shapesType)
      this method sets the type of the shape (line,rectangle or oval)
      void Undo()
      when the button Undo is clicked the last drawn shape will be cleared from the drawing panel, but all the other shapes will remain exactly as they were!

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawPanel

        public DrawPanel(javax.swing.JLabel coordinatesLabel,
                 DrawFrame parentWindow)
        this method sets the background color to white and creates an array in a size of MAXSHAPES(100) of type MyShape it also sets the coordinates (x,y) displayed on the screen and shows the mouse place creates a mouse handler and sets a mouse listener and a motion listener.
        Parameters:
        coordinatesLabel - the place of the mouse on the screen (x,y).
        parentWindow - the actual window we are working on to create the shapes. JComponent.setBackground(java.awt.Color) Component.addMouseListener(java.awt.event.MouseListener) Component.addMouseMotionListener(java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener)

        public void SetFilled(boolean filled)
        this method sets the oval/rectangle to filled or not filled.
        Parameters:
        filled - if true the shape is filled if false the shape is not filled.

      • createShape

        private MyShape createShape(int shapeType,
                            java.awt.Color color,
                            boolean filled,
                            int... coordinates)
        this method creates the shapes. recieves the shape type, color and wether the shape is filled.
        Parameters:
        shapeType - the type of the shape to make.
        color - the color of the shape
        filled - wether the shape is filled or not
        coordinates - the coordinates of the shape using array or integers x1,y1,x2,y2
        Returns:
        new MyShape
